snippet: Computer security experts have identified vulnerabilities in the voter databases in Maryland and Washington State, raising concerns about the ability of hackers to disenfranchise voters.
abstract: Computer security experts have identified vulnerabilities in voter registration databases in Maryland and Washington State, raising concerns about ability of hackers and others to disenfranchise voters.
lead_paragraph: Computer security experts have identified vulnerabilities in the voter databases in Maryland and Washington State, raising concerns about the ability of hackers to disenfranchise voters.

headline.seo: Cracks in Maryland and Washington Voter Databases
headline.main: Voter Registration Rolls in 2 States Are Called Vulnerable to Hackers
headline.print_headline: Voter Registration Rolls in 2 States Are Called Vulnerable to Hackers
